meanings.definition: The act of elevating or raising something above a normal level.
meanings.sent1: The superelevation of the platform made it easier for passengers to board the train.
meanings.sent2: The superelevation of the mountain path provided stunning views of the valley below.
meanings.sent3: The superelevation of the cake with extra frosting made it a towering dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a superelevation that lifted the spirits of everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The superelevation of the music in the concert hall created a sense of grandeur and awe.

meanings.definition: The amount by which a road or railway track is banked on a curve to counteract centrifugal force.
meanings.sent1: The engineer calculated the necessary superelevation for the sharp turn on the highway.
meanings.sent2: The superelevation of the train tracks allowed the trains to travel safely at high speeds around bends.
meanings.sent3: The superelevation of the roller coaster track added an element of thrill to the ride.
meanings.sent4: The superelevation of the road felt like a gentle tilt as the car navigated the curve.
meanings.sent5: The superelevation of the ski slope ensured a smooth descent for the skiers.
